title: PROJECT Panorama Splash!
body:
Hey Everyone! 

We've seen a lot of you guys putting together all of the PROJECT skins to create the panorama view and thought we'd help out!

replies.body: Who is "we", specifically?
The team who worked on PROJECT! Suke put this together. ^-^
So, we got 5 "good guy" project skin (Fiora,Yi,Yasuo,Leona and Lucian), thats possible to we get 5 "bad guy" project skin (Top,Jungle,Zed,Support and Adc)?

ENTER: PROJECT: SORAKA

INITIATE DESTRUCTION.
please. please pleasepleaseplease I would love PROJECT soraka!!

imo PROJECT: Diana would've been a good fit instead of Lucian, he looks so clunky in his new attire... (I am ready to be flamed, :D)

plus Diana could've been on Zed's side in the video fighting against Leona... 
nvm rito, u tried...

ACTIVATE BANANASTORM_
Then if we had a PROJECT: map we could play what would look like an entirely different game. Riot Please!

> [{quoted}](name=Mr Gnar,realm=EUNE,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=Nqk9ebaI,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-10T20:27:28.453+0000)
>
> So, we got 5 "good guy" project skin (Fiora,Yi,Yasuo,Leona and Lucian), thats possible to we get 5 "bad guy" project skin (Zed,Zed,Zed,Zed and Zed)?

ftfy. shadows everywhere man
Zed is a lane now xD
Project is actually the mirror to Battlecast. Heroes who once fell to Viktors mighty machines have been given knew life to fight again.

I honestly assumed that the Resistance skin line was the opposing force (or good guys) to the Battlecast skin lineup. Except that the Resistance skins existed before Viktor was even released, so probably it seems a bit silly to begin with.

They sort of hamfisted that retcon in when Battlecast really got fleshed out, and even then it really doesn't add up much. The PROJECT line looks a lot more like what a resistance to the Battlecast line would be. They realized that they can't overcome the evolution so they begin trying to augment humans on their own terms to defeat Viktor, making a point of keeping the original flesh and body, but accidentally end up with creations that actually have less of the original personality that Viktor's creations do as they struggle to match his overwhelming forces. 

Of course they hint that there is some humanity left but it causes inner conflict, a struggle to either bring it out (Robocop style) or the remnants of humanity cause issues with the tech/software. Either way thinking that it began as a gambit for survival via fighting fire with fire makes the whole skin series seem more interesting to me.

In all fairness, it's difficult to add up a concept when it hasn't been explored with cinematics, promotionals or lore like PROJECT or Battlecast has. If anything, using the Resistance skin line as the protagonist between the two is just as fruitful as saying that the... Idk, for examples sake, the Headhunter lineup is the contra to the Battlecast lineup. Maybe the Headhunters are those who utilize high end technological upgrades without consulting to biological modifications to destroy the Battlecast terror? Especially with assassins like Rengar, Akali, and Cait as a sniper (which in concept bears assassin qualities) sort of pushes the idea of a "move in, execute target, move out" approach that would work as a fitting tactic against terminators. Of course we'll never know because there's nothing to promote that skin line.  

Still, I really do like your theory. However, directly from the Battlecast promotional website, the Resistance lineup actually has a reference to the Battlecast skin line. This was Viktor's quote when talking about Battlecast Kog'Maw: "My enhancements transformed the organism into a mechanized mortar. Full scale production initiated. The skies will scream with living artillery. **The Resistance** will crumble" ( from http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/skin-release/battlecast-skins ).  If anything, I think PROJECT is just another universe within that of League's.
Wait, I always thought the full metal skins were the opposing side to the Battlecast since Jayce and Viktor Oppose each other in the lore?

Uhm, just no. Reading the Riot-post about the PROJECT-series and how they transcended humanity reveals that PROJECT has nothing to do with Viktor or Battlecast, or Mecha for that matter. Their only ties being... well, mechanical.

They are from an alternative universe and in an apocalypse-like world. Mecha and Battlecast are not.

Actualy, Zed is the project that went Rogue, so, he was initialy in the same team as the others.... It makes sense. Yasuo was the original, the project was a success and they made 5 upgrades but the assassin of the team went rogue. So now, yasuo returns to join the team as they ty to take down Zed. Too bad that only Yi has a chance against Zed... Or does he?

You understand that if that teamcomp snowballs they are unstoppable right? The ALL AD statement is not very important when you have a mad lady with a sword taking away 20% of your HP in true damage in one hit or a dude that his ult can do some insane amounts of damage after 3 seconds. Zed, Fiora and lucian alone, if they snowball they are unstopable.. If you add yi to the mix, oh boy that will hurt.
